alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 30 at 8:21AM AKST until December 30 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...LOCALIZED HEAVY SNOW BAND... A band of heavy snow will remain stalled north of the Mendenhall Valley where temperatures remain below freezing. The Downtown Juneau area will see a mix and less accumulations. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. * WHERE...Juneau, from Mendenhall Valley northward. * WHEN...Until 3 PM AKST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Reports of 4 to 7 inches have already been received out the road from Lena Point to Yankee Cove. This area will see the greatest additional accumulation.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
